column4: hey can anyone help me - I need a way to use different configurations in different sessions
I used to do something similar with my laptop for when it was docked or not.
I had to write a script at init to detect "something" to work out if it was docked and then put the correct xorg.conf in place.
is it easy?  what script do I need to edit?  can you point me in the direction of somewhere that I can learn to do this?
its not straight forward, more so for you as you want a different setting based on your desktop
what I was thinking is that I need multiple xconf files
however by the time you login, X is already running so you'll need to restart, in which case you'll get logged out
so how do I make it so that I can switch between them?  is there a command line utility that reloads the config that I can run from a script?
I can't figure a way to do it that way
you can init it before xorg loads, but I don't know how to dynamically do it
try #xorg see if they have any options
ok will do.  Thanks for your help
